physdesc.extent: 10.85 linear ft. (24 music file boxes, 11 manuscript boxes, and 1 oversized box)

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

did.abstract: Eda Rapoport was a Jewish American composer and pianist. Her papers are comprised primarily of manuscripts of musical scores arranged by Rapoport, as well as commercially-printed music. The collection also features vinyl recordings of concerts given by Rapoport throughout her career.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Eda Rapoport was a Jewish American composer and pianist. Born December 25, 1890 in Daugavpils, Latvia, she later immigrated to the United States, where she lived much of her life in New York. Considered a prolific composer of her day, she arranged several hundred compositions for piano, violin, voice, and symphony orchestra. Rapoport died on May 9, 1968 at her home in Manhattan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Eda Rapoport Papers are comprised primarily of music manuscripts authored by Rapoport, many of which are autographs. While most of the manuscripts are undated, they are accompanied by bound albums, which contain vinyl recordings of concerts given by Rapoport throughout her career. Most of the records are labeled according to the date and piece performed, and span between 1939 and 1966. The collection also features a small selection of printed music, originally intended for commercial distribution. Also, diaries of her musical life, 1932-1948, kept by her husband, Boris Rapoport.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in three series:
Series I: Original Accession
Series II: Later Accession- Scores
Subseries II.1 Manuscript Music
Subseries II.2 Printed music
Series III: Sound recordings

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1969 M-69 Rapoport, Dr. Boris and Eda Bequest

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Eda Rothstein Rapoport Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of both the physical property and copyright. To request permission to quote or publish, please contact the RBML at rbml@columbia.edu.

did.unittitle: Quartet, Piano, Flute, Violin, and Violoncello
Quintet, Flute and String Quartet no. 2
Quintet, Flute and String Quartet no.1
The Hobo and the Old Maid

scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of musical scores authored by Rapoport, and includes both manuscript and printed material.

The bulk of the collection, this subseries contains manuscript musical scores, most of which are autographs. While most are not original manuscripts, the vast majority are engravings in Rapoport’s own handwriting. This subseries is arranged alphabetically by title.

unittitle.title: The Angel for voice and pianoforte
Chant Hebraique for violoncello or viola and pianoforte
The Clown for violin and pianoforte
Duo for Violin and Cello, Abstract and Non-Objective
Echoes from the Forest for violin and piano
Four Episodes from the Life of Moses for pianoforte
The House on the Bay for pianoforte
Impressions for violin solo or violin and pianoforte
Invocation and Caprice for cello and piano
Looking Through My Window, for unaccompanied violin
Moods of the Past, for violin alone
Mysterious Forest, for five strings and one flute
Night You Are a Gypsy, for soprano
Nocturne in E, for violin and piano
The Old Castle, Air de Ballet
Perpetuum Mobile, for violin and pianoforte
Petite Poem, for violin and piano
Rocks and Sea, for pianoforte solo
Sea Fog, for violin and pianoforte
Sholom Aleichem Suite, for violin and pianoforte
Song and Dance, for violin alone
Song of the Gondolier, for violin alone
Song of the River, for cello and piano

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains printed reproductions of Rapoport’s works. Unlike Subseries I.1, they are not handwritten copies; rather, they are machine-produced and were intended for commercial distribution. This subseries is arranged alphabetically by title.

unittitle.title: Agada, for violin or violoncello and piano
Berceuse Perpetuum Mobile, for violin and pianoforte
Drinking Song, words from the Russian, by Harry Fein
Lamentations, based on Hebrew Themes, for violoncello and piano
Nigun, for violin or violoncello and piano
The River, poem by Paul Eisman
Sleep, Little Baby, song by Eda Rapoport
Thoughts in the Night, for violin or violoncello and piano
Thoughts in the Night (Harhorey Lailah), poem by Ch. N. Bialik

scopecontent.p: This subseries features eight albums containing vinyl recordings of various concerts given by Rapoport throughout her career. Included also is a recording on magnetic tape. The albums are dated between 1939 and 1966 and are arranged in their original order. They are accompanied by an itemized list of the works performed and date recorded, though this information is not available for every recording. The albums are fragile and should be handled with care.
